top_rare_diseases.description: A rare genetic disorder characterized by kidney disease, hearing loss, and eye abnormalities.
top_rare_diseases.overview: Alport Syndrome is a rare genetic disorder that affects the type IV collagen in the body, leading to kidney disease, hearing loss, and eye abnormalities.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: Alport Syndrome can lead to end-stage renal disease, hearing loss, and vision problems if left untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Genetic mutations in the COL4A3, COL4A4, or COL4A5 genes.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Genetic testing, kidney biopsy, hearing tests, and eye exams.
top_rare_diseases.treatment: Medications to manage symptoms, dialysis, and kidney transplantation.
key_aspects: Regular monitoring of kidney function and hearing

top_rare_diseases.description: A rare kidney disease characterized by scarring of the glomeruli.
top_rare_diseases.overview: FSGS is a rare kidney disease that affects the glomeruli, leading to kidney damage and scarring.
top_rare_diseases.clinical_significance: FSGS can lead to end-stage renal disease if left untreated.
top_rare_diseases.causes: Genetic mutations, infections, and certain medications.
top_rare_diseases.diagnosis: Kidney biopsy, urine tests, and blood work.
top_rare_diseases.treatment: Medications to manage symptoms, dialysis, and kidney transplantation.
